summary: Navmesh Patch for the DEFAULT/VANILLA Breezehome located in Whiterun.
descriptionHtml:
[size=2]This mod is a navmesh fix for the [color=#ffff00]default/vanilla Breezehome[/color] located in Whiterun.  It also fixes Lydia's bed and sandbox.

What is navmesh?  [i][color=#cccccc]Navmesh is the pathing that indicates where NPC's can and cannot walk/run[/color][/i].  Incorrect Navmesh can cause NPC's to "teleport" around, get stuck in spots, and/or continuously attempt to walk into furniture.  Having no Navmesh will not allow NPC's to walk/run in the area.  IE, if you build a new home and don't put down a navmesh, no NPC can enter other than yourself.[/size]

[u][color=#00ffff]WHAT WAS FIXED[/color][/u][color=#00ffff]:
[/color]
[list=1]
[*][color=#00ff00][size=2]Navmesh[/size][/color]
[*][color=#00ff00][size=2]Lydia's Bed[/size][/color]
[*][color=#00ff00][size=2]Lydia's Sandbox[/size][/color]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Navmesh in Breezehome wasn't properly placed, especially on the stairs which is why NPC's had trouble getting up and down.  The original navmesh was under the stairs instead of on top.  [/size]
[/list][size=2]
[list]
[*][size=2]The original Navmesh is still intact and not deleted, just moved.  I manually placed a new navmesh layout throughout the house.[/size]
[/list]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Lydia's bed marker was on the wrong side facing outside of the house, not allowing her to access her bed.  Her original bed was "CommonBed01R".  I switched it to "CommonBed01L" so the bed marker is facing inside the house and can be accessed by the house navmesh.  The original navmesh by Lydia's bed was also two triangles by themselves, separate from the the rest of the house's navmesh.  This also causes Lydia to not be able to walk to her bed.  The navmesh is now one full navmesh throughout the house, as it should be.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Lydia now has her own sandbox for Breezehome and will walk about the whole place[i].[/i][/size]
[/list]
[color=#ff0000][u]INCOMPATIBLE[/u]:
[/color][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]Any mod that alters Breezehome and its layout.  If you have a mod that changes the layout of Breezehome, that mod author should have already changed the navmesh in their mod to fit their new layout.  If not, you'll be having serious pathing issues with NPC's.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]If you use USKP or USLEEP, you do not need this patch.[/size]
[/list]
[color=#00ffff][u]INSTALLATION:[/u][/color]
[size=2]Use NMM or MO.[/size]

[color=#00ffff][u]MANUAL INSTALLATION:[/u][/color]
[size=2]Drop the data folder into your main Skyrim directory.

[u][color=#ff7700]CONCERNING USKP:
[/color][/u][/size][size=2]
[list]
[*][size=2]NOT EVERYONE USES USKP/USLEEP.  These navmesh fixes will mainly be for those who don't use USKP/USLEEP.  So please, I don't need anymore postings about USKP/USLEEP.  I had already taken USKP/USLEEP into consideration and checked their navmeshes before I even bothered doing these mods.  Thank you.[/size]
[/list]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]I read that Belethor's shop was fixed from the outside in the USKP as well.  However, I do use all of the USKP's and my followers never came in through Belethor's front door.  I'm not saying that it is not fixed by the USKP, it's just for my games... they come in through the back still.  BUT I also do use JK's Skyrim and The Useless Shop Overhaul in my actual non-vanilla game.  So... probably mod's conflicting with USKP is why they weren't using the front door.  But this mod is for the default/vanilla game anyway and I have been testing this with vanilla cells.  This is in concern of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70629]Navmesh Fix - Belethor's General Goods[/url].[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2]I've gone back over USKP and realized that their patch talks about [i]Belethor himself[/i], not followers.  They fixed the game so that [i]Belethor enters his shop through the front instead of the back[/i].  That's not what this patch is. Plus, IMO I don't know why USKP changes that. Shop owners I know IRL use their back door (if they have one) to enter so they can turn on lights, set up shop, etc before opening.  IMO, I think Belethor should be entering in and out of his shop through the back door anyway.  I thought Bethesda intended him to do so in the first place. This is in concern of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70629]Navmesh Fix - Belethor's General Goods[/url].[/size]
[/list]
author: Baibaihe

files.name: Navmesh Fix - Breezehome Vanilla
files.changelogHtml:
Original Navmesh is still intact and not deleted. It has now been moved down under the house.
Lydia has her own sandbox for Breezhome and should walk around the house.

Original Navmesh is still intact and not deleted. It has now been moved down under the house.
Lydia has her own sandbox for Breezhome and should walk around the house.
